BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: New snow and wind slabs require caution. The fresh wind slabs represent the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Above approximately 1300 m snow will fall until Thursday in particular along the border with France and along the border with Switzerland. The strong wind will transport the new snow significantly.
In these regions and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions the avalanche prone locations are more widespread and the danger is slightly greater.
The fresh wind slabs can be released even by a single winter sport participant on steep north, east and south facing slopes above approximately 2000 m.
The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on steep slopes and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. Remotely triggered avalanches are possible. Meticulous route selection is appropriate.
On very steep slopes medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large dry avalanches are possible as a consequence of the sometimes storm force northwesterly wind.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
20 to 30 cm of snow, but less in some localities, fell on Wednesday above approximately 2000 m.
Over a wide area new snow and wind slabs are lying on soft layers. In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with the old snowpack. The old snowpack is hard.
Below approximately 1800 m thus far only a little snow is lying. Snow depths vary greatly at high altitude, depending on the infuence of the wind.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Friday: A little new snow. During the day: The avalanche danger will increase but remain within the current danger level.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights:
The deep wind slabs of the last few days represent the main danger.
Backcountry touring calls for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and careful route selection.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Medium-sized and large avalanches are possible in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. The deep wind slabs of the last few days can be released even by a single winter sport participant. Natural avalanches and stability tests have confirmed this situation.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The wind slabs have bonded poorly with the old snowpack. Weak layers exist in the snowpack.
In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Over a wide area snowfall. As a consequence of new snow and wind, further wind slabs will form. The wind slabs will form in all aspects.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The more recent wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence above approximately 2200 m.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The fresh wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in some cases in high Alpine regions. At high altitude the avalanche prone locations are more prevalent.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: As a consequence of a sometimes strong wind, small wind slabs will form. Snow depths vary greatly at intermediate and high altitudes, depending on the infuence of the wind. In particular at low and intermediate altitudes a little snow is lying.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: New snow and wind slabs at elevated altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Little snow fell during the night. The wind was moderate to strong over a wide area.
In the last few days mostly small wind slabs formed in particular in gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. Fresh wind slabs can in some cases be released easily at their margins.
New snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
There is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
5 to 10 cm of snow, and up to 15 cm in some localities, fell on Tuesday above approximately 1800 m. The new snow is lying on a crust. In particular at elevated altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying.

BulletinMeasurements.highlights: The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on steep shady slopes above the tree line.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind slabs in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The fresh snow and the mostly small wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases in particular on steep, little used north, northeast and northwest facing slopes above approximately 2500 m.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The old snowpack will be favourable at intermediate and high altitudes. In particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls as well as at high altitude mostly small wind slabs formed.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind slabs represent the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Some snow fell during the night in some localities.
Since Sunday wind slabs formed in particular in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation as well as at intermediate and high altitudes.
These can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: 5 to 10 cm of snow fell on Tuesday above approximately 2000 m. In particular at elevated altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. Faceted weak layers exist in the snowpack on wind-loaded slopes.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights:
In some regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
The new snow and wind slabs of the last few days represent the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Medium-sized avalanches are possible in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. Over a wide area sometimes deep wind slabs formed. The wind slabs of the last few days can be released.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The wind slabs are to be evaluated with care and prudence in particular in steep terrain.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Fresh wind slabs represent the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of the strong wind, fresh snow drift accumulations will form. These are prone to triggering at elevated altitudes. Caution is to be exercised in particular adjacent to ridgelines in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain above approximately 2000 m. The number and size of avalanche prone locations will increase with altitude. These avalanche prone locations are easy to recognise.

In addition a latent danger of gliding avalanches exists, in particular on steep east, south and west facing slopes below approximately 2600 m. Gliding avalanches can be released at any time of day or night. In isolated cases they are quite large. This applies in the regions with a lot of snow. Caution is to be exercised in areas with glide cracks.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Some snow will fall in some localities. Over a wide area 5 to 20 cm of snow fell on Sunday above approximately 1000 m. In the Venediger Range up to 30 cm of snow fell on Sunday above approximately 1000 m. The wind will be strong over a wide area. The fresh wind slabs are lying on soft layers at elevated altitudes. The fresh wind slabs can in some cases be released easily.

The new snow is lying on a crust in all aspects below approximately 2600 m. Low and intermediate altitudes: The old snowpack is fairly homogeneous and its surface has a melt-freeze crust that is strong in many cases. This also applies on steep sunny slopes at high altitude.

The old snowpack will be stable over a wide area.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment:
Fresh wind slabs require caution.
A latent danger of gliding avalanches exists.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The conditions are generally favourable. Fresh wind slabs require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: As a consequence of snowfall and the strong wind, fresh snow drift accumulations formed. The wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases. At high altitude these avalanche prone locations are more prevalent. These avalanche prone locations are easy to recognise. Caution is to be exercised in particular adjacent to ridgelines in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain above approximately 2200 m.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Snow depths vary greatly above the tree line, depending on the infuence of the wind. The fresh wind slabs are poorly bonded with the old snowpack at elevated altitudes. Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted.
In particular at low and intermediate altitudes a little snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Fresh wind slabs require caution. The avalanche danger will persist.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights:
Little snow will fall until Thursday. The wind will be strong to storm force.
There is a danger of falling on the icy crust.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In some localities mostly small wind slabs will form. The new snow and wind slabs are lying on a crust in all aspects.
The greatest danger remains slipping on hard snow, so it is advisable to carry snow knives and crampons for the steepest sections.
Fresh wind slabs can be released in isolated cases at their margins. Especially transitions into gullies and bowls places that are protected from the wind, in particular on very steep slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
5 to 10 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell on Wednesday above approximately 2000 m. Over a wide area new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
Snow depths vary greatly at high altitude, depending on the infuence of the wind. In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with the old snowpack.
Especially on steep sunny slopes only a little snow is lying. Also adjacent to ridgelines hardly any snow is lying.
In its middle, the snowpack is fairly homogeneous and its surface has a crust that is strong in many cases. This applies below approximately 2600 m.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Friday: Some new snow. The avalanche danger will increase during the day.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Over a wide area from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized avalanches are possible in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. The new snow can be released in isolated cases, but mostly only by large additional loads.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The snowpack will be generally stable.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: In all aspects a little snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In these regions from a snow sport perspective, insufficient snow is lying.
Even in moderately steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the icy crust.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Hardly any snow is lying at intermediate and high altitudes. The snowpack is stable and its surface has a crust.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: In all aspects in all altitude zones thus far only a little snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In particular along the border with France some new snow above approximately 2300 m. The avalanche prone locations are rather rare. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.
Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Below approximately 2400 m from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying. At higher altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Fresh and older wind slabs require caution. Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found in steep terrain at high altitude.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: In all aspects as well as in all altitude zones from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying. Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found in shady places that are protected from the wind at high altitude.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: In all altitude zones only a little snow is lying. Snow depths vary greatly above the tree line, depending on the infuence of the wind. The snowpack will be quite stable.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The conditions are generally favourable. Fresh wind slabs require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In some places small wind slabs formed. The fresh wind slabs can be released in isolated cases on steep shady slopes in high Alpine regions. The avalanche prone locations are rare and are easy to recognise.
In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
In some regions up to 10 cm of snow has fallen above approximately 1000 m. The strong wind has transported the new snow. The old snowpack will be stable over a wide area.

Low and intermediate altitudes: The snowpack is wet all the way through and its surface has a melt-freeze crust that is strong in many cases.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The new snow of the day before yesterday is lying on top of a favourable old snowpack in particular on steep shady slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The danger exists in particular in alpine snow sports terrain.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Weak layers in the old snowpack represent the main danger.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The more recent wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The fresh wind slabs are to be bypassed as far as possible in high Alpine regions. At high altitude the avalanche prone locations are more prevalent.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: As a consequence of a sometimes strong wind, small wind slabs will form. Only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year in all altitude zones.
